Name: Photos of Jinzhou
Description: You find a crowd in a peculiar corner of Jinzhou. Why not go and check it out?
QuestDesc: You find a crowd in a peculiar corner of Jinzhou. Why not go and check it out?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ack... My hand. Age is finally catching up to me, I guess...

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you so much for saving me. If you wasn't here, I might have faceplanted into the ground by now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's okay, I'm fine. As long as my camera is okay, everything’s okay. It's still working perfectly! But my hand... *sigh* What about the photos?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah. I'm putting together a photo collection called "Old Memories of Jinzhou". Basically, it's a mix of old and new photos of the city.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I work for a magazine called Wutherium Geographic as a journalist with the Pioneer Association.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our job is to take pictures and share the beauty of the world with people who can't travel.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've been working hard for this goal. I may not look the part now, but when I was younger, I traveled across mountains and rivers, taking countless photos, and some of which even won awards!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But all of that is in the past. I'm getting old and close to retirement...

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And now my hand is busted, which is just great. *sigh* With only three places left to go, too. I guess I won't be able to finish the last set of photos before I retire...

Options.PlotLineKey: I can give you a hand.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Really? Do you really mean it? I don’t know what to say! I-I'll credit you in the magazine and you’ll get paid for sure. Please, you're my only hope!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah! Take my camera. All you need to do is aim it at the scenery you want to shoot and press the shutter release, and the moment will be forever captured...

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The first scenery is that high ground where I was earlier. Good luck and be careful!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nice. Let me take a look at it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's see here... It's spectacular! You're quite natural for photography, aren't you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just look at the transparency of this pond!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I really liked this place when I was a kid. I’d always come here by myself to play.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My parents was worried that I might end up go swimming in it or something on my own, so they gave me a camera.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My dad said if I saw anything I liked, I should take a picture of it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, with something expensive in my hands, I wouldn’t dare jump into the water with it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I ended up taking a lot of photos because of it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There was this one time where I took a picture almost at the same angle as yours and mailed it to a magazine publisher. And whaddaya know! It got selected for one of their knew releases!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's how I started learning photography, which got better and better by the day. And so did Jinzhou started to thrive.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There were more people on the streets, more shops, and businesses more prosperous. It was a good time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Okay, I think that’s enough mumbling. Please excuse me, I can't stop thinking about things like this once I start.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We should move on to the next scenery. And the place is...

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh! I’ve got an idea! Do you like cats?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's great! Little kitties, fluffy and adorable. Everyone loves them!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha, dogs are nice too! But...

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You sure know how to be a cat!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Next, I would like you to take a picture of a cat. Sounds good?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll mark the location for you. Off we go.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Right there. See those cats, you can go give them a pet if you’d like.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well? Let see that cute furball.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Beautiful photo. Look how relaxed he is taking its nap. He looks so comfortable.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There used to be some small kittens around here as well. I’d come see them whenever I was back from a business trip.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And there was a calico just like this one. He grew pretty close to me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I’d often come see him, bring him something to eat, stroke his hair.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It’s a shame that I was busy with work and traveled a lot, so I couldn’t bring him home.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One time, I was away on a long business trip and I couldn’t find him anywhere after I came back.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It made me a bit sad so I stopped visiting for while.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then one day I happened to pass by and saw these kittens. There were also people coming over to feed and take care of them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I even asked around, and to my delight the calico ended up being adopted by a lovely family.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *chuckle* That's my story with cats. Now there’s only one more place left to go. And I have a favor to ask.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I’d like to ask you to take a picture of me in the residential area. I wish to make it the the final photo of the collection.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I need to make some preparations. Why don’t we meet there in a bit?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How’s the photo? Let’s give it a look.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, I'm so sorry. I’ve stared at it for too long.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I used to take pictures here with my family, just like that family.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It’s a family thing for us to take a picture here each year. I used to stand in the middle, with my dad having to hold me up just to get in the picture frame when I was younger.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After I grew older, I got big enough to wrap my arms around my parents' shoulders for the pictures.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The amount of family photos grew less after I left home for my job. Now, they're not here anywhere, but...

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Taking another photo here at the same spot, can count as telling them I'm doing pretty well, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah. I really appreciate your help today. If it wasn't for you, it would’ve been really hard for me to fulfill my wish of capturing the moments of Jinzhou!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I plan to mail these photos back to the publishing, crediting your name on them. Oh, dear. We’ve been so preoccupied with the photos, I haven’t got the chance to get your name yet.

Options.PlotLineKey: The esteemed Rover, at your service.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Got it. I am in your debt!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You must accept these as your reward. Keep my camera as well.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's an old pal of mine. Visited countless places with me over the years. I believe it deserves to continue its journey of capturing the beauties of the world with you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I trust you and your talent. Also, how about considering becoming a journalist in your free time?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. That's the one!

Dialogues.Speaker: Hurried Passerby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Look. Up there! He can't get down!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bowen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Help, help!
